answerText: Liver[10] Hepatocytes are responsible for detoxification; thus it makes sense that this organelle is highly developed in hepatocytes. Unlike a related organelle, it has no ribosomes on its surface, and it synthesizes lipids and steroids.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 3 | 12 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: An important function of this organ is impaired in Dubin-Johnson and Rotor syndrome, and it is a site of extramedullary hematopoiesis in the fetus along with the yolk sac. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this abdominal organ, which develops fibrotic scar tissue in cirrhosis. One of its primary functions is producing bile.
